trans-unit.source: Represents a response from WCF Data Services that contains binary data as a stream.
Gets the `Content-Disposition` header field for the response stream.
When the `Content-Disposition` header is not present in the response, the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse.ContentDisposition%2A> property returns `null`.
The contents of the `Content-Disposition` header field.
Gets the content type of the response stream.
When the `Content-Type` header is not present in the response, the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse.ContentDisposition%2A> property returns `null`.
The content type of the response stream.
Releases all resources used by the current instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse"></xref> class.
Call the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse.Dispose%2A> method when you have finished using the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse>.
This releases resources held by the object.

You should always do this to release the resources held by the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse>; otherwise, the consumed resources will not be released until after the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method on the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse> object.

After the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse.Dispose%2A> method is called and all references to the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse> are released, the memory used can be reclaimed by garbage collection.
You cannot use <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse> after calling the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse.Dispose%2A> method.
Gets the collection of headers from the response.
The response is a <xref:System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary%602> object that contains key-value pairs of strings for each header in the response.
The headers collection from the response message as a <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2"></xref> object.
Gets the binary property data from the data service as a binary stream.
When a network errors occurs while reading from this stream, an error is raised.
The returned <xref:System.IO.Stream> is read-only.

You must call either the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse.Dispose%2A> method on the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse> or the <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A> method on the <xref:System.IO.Stream>.
Otherwise, the network connection remains open and unavailable to other applications.
The <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse.GetResponseStream%2A> method is used to access the stream.
The stream that contains the binary property data.
When the <xref href="System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceStreamResponse"></xref> is already disposed.
